div.l: For holi chirche gode mote ben despended
On holi chirche blode that is descended
Therfor he wold his holi blood honoᵘur
Thouȝ that he holi chirche shulde deuoure
Gret soken hath this miller oute of doute
With whete and malt of al the land aboute
And namely ther was a gret college
Men clepe the soler halle at Cambrigge
Ther was here whete and eke her malt I grounde
Vpon̄ a day it happed in a stounde
Seke lay the Manciple on a maladie
Men wende wisely that he shuld dye
Fro which this meller stale bothe mele and corn̄
An C· tyme more than beforn̄
For there biforn̄ he stale but curteisly
But now he was a theef outerageously
For which the wardeyn chid ⁊and made fare
But therof set the meller nouȝt a tare
He craked boost and swore it was nouȝt so
Then were there yong pouer scoleres ijᵒ
That dwelten in the halle of which I sey
Testif thei were and lusty for to pleye
And oonly for hir mirthe and reuerye
Vpon̄ the wardein besily thei crie
To yeue hem leue but a litil stounde
To go to melle and seen̄ her corn̄ grounde
And hardeli thei dorst lay here nekke
The meller shuld nat stele hem half a pekke
Of corne ne be sleight ne be force hem reue
And at the last the wardein yaf hem leue
Iohn hiȝt that oon̄ and Aleyn hiȝt that othir
Of o toun̄ were thei born̄ that hiȝt Strother
Fer in the North I can nouȝt telle where
This Aleyn makith redi all his gere
